title: Where did Pearl go at the end of The Scarlet Letter? Why did she separate from Hester? - Quora

response.answer_text: Given my usual asks, I thought at first that this was some very weird episode of Steven Universe I’d somehow missed, maybe an issue of the comic. :) The end of the Scarlet Letter was “many years later” when Hester returned alone to Boston and resumed wearing the A. Her husband (the antagonist, under an assumed name) died shortly after Dimmesdale did, and left Pearl a significant inheritance. Presumably, Pearl set up life on her own as an adult (probably in Europe), prompting Hester to go back to Boston now that Pearl no longer needed her (and likely too guilt-ridden to want to stay in Pearl’s life once she was grown). ETA: Here’s all the book has to say. Hester never told anyone the fate of Pearl, but - “In fine, the gossips of that day believed—and Mr. Surveyor Pue, who made investigations a century later, believed—and one of his recent successors in office, moreover, faithfully believes—that Pearl was not only alive, but married, and happy, and mindful of her mother; and that she would most joyfully have entertained that sad and lonely mother at her fireside.” No one knew where, but she was one of the richest women in New England thanks to her inheritance, so she could have set herself up just about anywhere she pleased.
